Minguo shi qi wen xian zi liao hai wai shi yi /
"Minguo shi qi wen xian zi liao hai wai shi yi" bian ji zu.

Reprint. Minguo shi qi wen xian zi liao hai wai shi yi you Beijing da xue, Beijing shi fan da xue, fu dan da xue, hua dong shi fan da xue, Nanjing da xue, Nanjing shi fan da xue, Wuhan da xue, Xiamen da xue he Zhejiang da xue deng gao xiao de tu shu guan zu cheng gao xiao tu shu guan li shi wen xian lian meng, xi tong sou ji he zheng li liao cun cang yu hai wai Minguo wen xian de shu mu xin xi, bing yu guo nei tu shu guan de Minguo wen xian cang shu jin xing shu ju bi jiao, xuan ze chu qi zhong wei jian yu guo nei tu shu guan shou cang de xue shu jia zhi jiao gao de wen xian zi liao, sou ji mu ben, xian liang ying yin fu zhi, bing hui ji er cheng. ben tao shu gong 270 ce, mu lu suo yin yi ce, gong shou lu hai wai Minguo wen xian zi liao 710 zhong.

民國時期文獻資料海外拾遺 /
《民國時期文獻資料海外拾遺》編輯組.

Reprint. 民國時期文獻資料海外拾遺由北京大學、北京師範大學、復旦大學、華東師範大學、南京大學、南京師範大學、武漢大學、廈門大學和浙江大學等高校的圖書館组成高校圖書館歷史文獻聯盟, 系統搜集和整理了存藏于海外民國文獻的書目信息, 並與國內圖書館的民國文獻藏書進行數據比較, 選擇出其中未見於國內圖書館收藏的學術價值較高的文獻資料, 搜集母本, 限量影印複製, 並匯輯而成. 本套書共270册, 目錄索引一冊, 共收錄海外民國文獻資料710種.

ha-teʼaṭron shel Dz'igan ṿe-Shumakher, 1927-1980 = Stage as a temporary home : on Dzigan and Shumacher's theater, 1927-1980 /
Hotsaʼat sefarim ʻa. sh. Y.L. Magnes, ha-Universiṭah ha-ʻIvrit,

The Stage as a Temporary Home takes us through the fascinating stages in the life and career of the duo Shimen Dzigan and Isroel Shumacher, over the course of half a century - from the beginning of their work at the Ararat avant-garde Yiddish theater in Łodz, Poland, and to their Warsaw theater, where they produced bold, groundbreaking political satire. The book further discusses their wanderings through the Soviet Union during the Second World War and their attempt to revive Jewish culture in Poland after the Holocaust, and finally describes their arrival in Israel, first as guest performers and later as permanent residents. Despite the restrictions on Yiddish actors in Israel, the duo insisted on performing in their own language and succeeded in translating the new Israeli reality into unique and timely satire. In the 1950s, they voiced a political and cultural critique of a kind that was not heard on any of the Hebrew stages. After they parted ways, and following the death of Shumacher in 1961, Dzigan continued to perform on his own and with other Israeli artists until his death in 1980. The book is based on rare recordings, transcriptions, programs, personal diaries, letters, photographs, oral testimonies, and critical articles, all of which come together to create the first critical portrait of this extraordinary duo. The book also examines their art, the connection between theater and politics, and the complex relationship between majority culture and minority language. The study includes several valuable indexes: of titles of programs and plays, of the artists who participated in them, of writers and the drafts they wrote, of actors and the programs in which they participated, and a general name index. The book also includes a facsimile of the manuscript Der Nayer Dybbuk [The New Dybbuk].
התאטרון של דז'יגאן ושומאכר, 1927-1980 = Stage as a temporary home : on Dzigan and Shumacher's theater, 1927-1980 /

Minguo shi qi wen xian zi liao hai wai shi yi you Beijing da xue, Beijing shi fan da xue, fu dan da xue, hua dong shi fan da xue, Nanjing da xue, Nanjing shi fan da xue, Wuhan da xue, Xiamen da xue he Zhejiang da xue deng gao xiao de tu shu guan zu cheng gao xiao tu shu guan li shi wen xian lian meng, xi tong sou ji he zheng li liao cun cang yu hai wai Minguo wen xian de shu mu xin xi, bing yu guo nei tu shu guan de Minguo wen xian cang shu jin xing shu ju bi jiao, xuan ze chu qi zhong wei jian yu guo nei tu shu guan shou cang de xue shu jia zhi jiao gao de wen xian zi liao, sou ji mu ben, xian liang ying yin fu zhi, bing hui ji er cheng. ben tao shu gong 270 ce, mu lu suo yin yi ce, gong shou lu hai wai Minguo wen xian zi liao 710 zhong.

民國時期文獻資料海外拾遺 /
《民國時期文獻資料海外拾遺》編輯組.

Reprint. 民國時期文獻資料海外拾遺由北京大學、北京師範大學、復旦大學、華東師範大學、南京大學、南京師範大學、武漢大學、廈門大學和浙江大學等高校的圖書館组成高校圖書館歷史文獻聯盟, 系統搜集和整理了存藏于海外民國文獻的書目信息, 並與國內圖書館的民國文獻藏書進行數據比較, 選擇出其中未見於國內圖書館收藏的學術價值較高的文獻資料, 搜集母本, 限量影印複製, 並匯輯而成. 本套書共270册, 目錄索引一冊, 共收錄海外民國文獻資料710種.

ha-teʼaṭron shel Dz'igan ṿe-Shumakher, 1927-1980 = Stage as a temporary home : on Dzigan and Shumacher's theater, 1927-1980 /
Hotsaʼat sefarim ʻa. sh. Y.L. Magnes, ha-Universiṭah ha-ʻIvrit,

The Stage as a Temporary Home takes us through the fascinating stages in the life and career of the duo Shimen Dzigan and Isroel Shumacher, over the course of half a century - from the beginning of their work at the Ararat avant-garde Yiddish theater in Łodz, Poland, and to their Warsaw theater, where they produced bold, groundbreaking political satire. The book further discusses their wanderings through the Soviet Union during the Second World War and their attempt to revive Jewish culture in Poland after the Holocaust, and finally describes their arrival in Israel, first as guest performers and later as permanent residents. Despite the restrictions on Yiddish actors in Israel, the duo insisted on performing in their own language and succeeded in translating the new Israeli reality into unique and timely satire. In the 1950s, they voiced a political and cultural critique of a kind that was not heard on any of the Hebrew stages. After they parted ways, and following the death of Shumacher in 1961, Dzigan continued to perform on his own and with other Israeli artists until his death in 1980. The book is based on rare recordings, transcriptions, programs, personal diaries, letters, photographs, oral testimonies, and critical articles, all of which come together to create the first critical portrait of this extraordinary duo. The book also examines their art, the connection between theater and politics, and the complex relationship between majority culture and minority language. The study includes several valuable indexes: of titles of programs and plays, of the artists who participated in them, of writers and the drafts they wrote, of actors and the programs in which they participated, and a general name index. The book also includes a facsimile of the manuscript Der Nayer Dybbuk [The New Dybbuk].
התאטרון של דז'יגאן ושומאכר, 1927-1980 = Stage as a temporary home : on Dzigan and Shumacher's theater, 1927-1980 /

Minguo shi qi wen xian zi liao hai wai shi yi you Beijing da xue, Beijing shi fan da xue, fu dan da xue, hua dong shi fan da xue, Nanjing da xue, Nanjing shi fan da xue, Wuhan da xue, Xiamen da xue he Zhejiang da xue deng gao xiao de tu shu guan zu cheng gao xiao tu shu guan li shi wen xian lian meng, xi tong sou ji he zheng li liao cun cang yu hai wai Minguo wen xian de shu mu xin xi, bing yu guo nei tu shu guan de Minguo wen xian cang shu jin xing shu ju bi jiao, xuan ze chu qi zhong wei jian yu guo nei tu shu guan shou cang de xue shu jia zhi jiao gao de wen xian zi liao, sou ji mu ben, xian liang ying yin fu zhi, bing hui ji er cheng. ben tao shu gong 270 ce, mu lu suo yin yi ce, gong shou lu hai wai Minguo wen xian zi liao 710 zhong.

民國時期文獻資料海外拾遺 /
《民國時期文獻資料海外拾遺》編輯組.

Reprint. 民國時期文獻資料海外拾遺由北京大學、北京師範大學、復旦大學、華東師範大學、南京大學、南京師範大學、武漢大學、廈門大學和浙江大學等高校的圖書館组成高校圖書館歷史文獻聯盟, 系統搜集和整理了存藏于海外民國文獻的書目信息, 並與國內圖書館的民國文獻藏書進行數據比較, 選擇出其中未見於國內圖書館收藏的學術價值較高的文獻資料, 搜集母本, 限量影印複製, 並匯輯而成. 本套書共270册, 目錄索引一冊, 共收錄海外民國文獻資料710種.

ha-teʼaṭron shel Dz'igan ṿe-Shumakher, 1927-1980 = Stage as a temporary home : on Dzigan and Shumacher's theater, 1927-1980 /
Hotsaʼat sefarim ʻa. sh. Y.L. Magnes, ha-Universiṭah ha-ʻIvrit,

The Stage as a Temporary Home takes us through the fascinating stages in the life and career of the duo Shimen Dzigan and Isroel Shumacher, over the course of half a century - from the beginning of their work at the Ararat avant-garde Yiddish theater in Łodz, Poland, and to their Warsaw theater, where they produced bold, groundbreaking political satire. The book further discusses their wanderings through the Soviet Union during the Second World War and their attempt to revive Jewish culture in Poland after the Holocaust, and finally describes their arrival in Israel, first as guest performers and later as permanent residents. Despite the restrictions on Yiddish actors in Israel, the duo insisted on performing in their own language and succeeded in translating the new Israeli reality into unique and timely satire. In the 1950s, they voiced a political and cultural critique of a kind that was not heard on any of the Hebrew stages. After they parted ways, and following the death of Shumacher in 1961, Dzigan continued to perform on his own and with other Israeli artists until his death in 1980. The book is based on rare recordings, transcriptions, programs, personal diaries, letters, photographs, oral testimonies, and critical articles, all of which come together to create the first critical portrait of this extraordinary duo. The book also examines their art, the connection between theater and politics, and the complex relationship between majority culture and minority language. The study includes several valuable indexes: of titles of programs and plays, of the artists who participated in them, of writers and the drafts they wrote, of actors and the programs in which they participated, and a general name index. The book also includes a facsimile of the manuscript Der Nayer Dybbuk [The New Dybbuk].

Minguo shi qi wen xian zi liao hai wai shi yi you Beijing da xue, Beijing shi fan da xue, fu dan da xue, hua dong shi fan da xue, Nanjing da xue, Nanjing shi fan da xue, Wuhan da xue, Xiamen da xue he Zhejiang da xue deng gao xiao de tu shu guan zu cheng gao xiao tu shu guan li shi wen xian lian meng, xi tong sou ji he zheng li liao cun cang yu hai wai Minguo wen xian de shu mu xin xi, bing yu guo nei tu shu guan de Minguo wen xian cang shu jin xing shu ju bi jiao, xuan ze chu qi zhong wei jian yu guo nei tu shu guan shou cang de xue shu jia zhi jiao gao de wen xian zi liao, sou ji mu ben, xian liang ying yin fu zhi, bing hui ji er cheng. ben tao shu gong 270 ce, mu lu suo yin yi ce, gong shou lu hai wai Minguo wen xian zi liao 710 zhong.

民國時期文獻資料海外拾遺 /
《民國時期文獻資料海外拾遺》編輯組.

Reprint. 民國時期文獻資料海外拾遺由北京大學、北京師範大學、復旦大學、華東師範大學、南京大學、南京師範大學、武漢大學、廈門大學和浙江大學等高校的圖書館组成高校圖書館歷史文獻聯盟, 系統搜集和整理了存藏于海外民國文獻的書目信息, 並與國內圖書館的民國文獻藏書進行數據比較, 選擇出其中未見於國內圖書館收藏的學術價值較高的文獻資料, 搜集母本, 限量影印複製, 並匯輯而成. 本套書共270册, 目錄索引一冊, 共收錄海外民國文獻資料710種.

ha-teʼaṭron shel Dz'igan ṿe-Shumakher, 1927-1980 = Stage as a temporary home : on Dzigan and Shumacher's theater, 1927-1980 /
Hotsaʼat sefarim ʻa. sh. Y.L. Magnes, ha-Universiṭah ha-ʻIvrit,

The Stage as a Temporary Home takes us through the fascinating stages in the life and career of the duo Shimen Dzigan and Isroel Shumacher, over the course of half a century - from the beginning of their work at the Ararat avant-garde Yiddish theater in Łodz, Poland, and to their Warsaw theater, where they produced bold, groundbreaking political satire. The book further discusses their wanderings through the Soviet Union during the Second World War and their attempt to revive Jewish culture in Poland after the Holocaust, and finally describes their arrival in Israel, first as guest performers and later as permanent residents. Despite the restrictions on Yiddish actors in Israel, the duo insisted on performing in their own language and succeeded in translating the new Israeli reality into unique and timely satire. In the 1950s, they voiced a political and cultural critique of a kind that was not heard on any of the Hebrew stages. After they parted ways, and following the death of Shumacher in 1961, Dzigan continued to perform on his own and with other Israeli artists until his death in 1980. The book is based on rare recordings, transcriptions, programs, personal diaries, letters, photographs, oral testimonies, and critical articles, all of which come together to create the first critical portrait of this extraordinary duo. The book also examines their art, the connection between theater and politics, and the complex relationship between majority culture and minority language. The study includes several valuable indexes: of titles of programs and plays, of the artists who participated in them, of writers and the drafts they wrote, of actors and the programs in which they participated, and a general name index. The book also includes a facsimile of the manuscript Der Nayer Dybbuk [The New Dybbuk].
התאטרון של דז'יגאן ושומאכר, 1927-1980 = Stage as a temporary home : on Dzigan and Shumacher's theater, 1927-1980 /

Minguo shi qi wen xian zi liao hai wai shi yi /
"Minguo shi qi wen xian zi liao hai wai shi yi" bian ji zu.

Reprint. Minguo shi qi wen xian zi liao hai wai shi yi you Beijing da xue, Beijing shi fan da xue, fu dan da xue, hua dong shi fan da xue, Nanjing da xue, Nanjing shi fan da xue, Wuhan da xue, Xiamen da xue he Zhejiang da xue deng gao xiao de tu shu guan zu cheng gao xiao tu shu guan li shi wen xian lian meng, xi tong sou ji he zheng li liao cun cang yu hai wai Minguo wen xian de shu mu xin xi, bing yu guo nei tu shu guan de Minguo wen xian cang shu jin xing shu ju bi jiao, xuan ze chu qi zhong wei jian yu guo nei tu shu guan shou cang de xue shu jia zhi jiao gao de wen xian zi liao, sou ji mu ben, xian liang ying yin fu zhi, bing hui ji er cheng. ben tao shu gong 270 ce, mu lu suo yin yi ce, gong shou lu hai wai Minguo wen xian zi liao 710 zhong.

民國時期文獻資料海外拾遺 /
《民國時期文獻資料海外拾遺》編輯組.

Reprint. 民國時期文獻資料海外拾遺由北京大學、北京師範大學、復旦大學、華東師範大學、南京大學、南京師範大學、武漢大學、廈門大學和浙江大學等高校的圖書館组成高校圖書館歷史文獻聯盟, 系統搜集和整理了存藏于海外民國文獻的書目信息, 並與國內圖書館的民國文獻藏書進行數據比較, 選擇出其中未見於國內圖書館收藏的學術價值較高的文獻資料, 搜集母本, 限量影印複製, 並匯輯而成. 本套書共270册, 目錄索引一冊, 共收錄海外民國文獻資料710種.

ha-teʼaṭron shel Dz'igan ṿe-Shumakher, 1927-1980 = Stage as a temporary home : on Dzigan and Shumacher's theater, 1927-1980 /
Hotsaʼat sefarim ʻa. sh. Y.L. Magnes, ha-Universiṭah ha-ʻIvrit,

The Stage as a Temporary Home takes us through the fascinating stages in the life and career of the duo Shimen Dzigan and Isroel Shumacher, over the course of half a century - from the beginning of their work at the Ararat avant-garde Yiddish theater in Łodz, Poland, and to their Warsaw theater, where they produced bold, groundbreaking political satire. The book further discusses their wanderings through the Soviet Union during the Second World War and their attempt to revive Jewish culture in Poland after the Holocaust, and finally describes their arrival in Israel, first as guest performers and later as permanent residents. Despite the restrictions on Yiddish actors in Israel, the duo insisted on performing in their own language and succeeded in translating the new Israeli reality into unique and timely satire. In the 1950s, they voiced a political and cultural critique of a kind that was not heard on any of the Hebrew stages. After they parted ways, and following the death of Shumacher in 1961, Dzigan continued to perform on his own and with other Israeli artists until his death in 1980. The book is based on rare recordings, transcriptions, programs, personal diaries, letters, photographs, oral testimonies, and critical articles, all of which come together to create the first critical portrait of this extraordinary duo. The book also examines their art, the connection between theater and politics, and the complex relationship between majority culture and minority language. The study includes several valuable indexes: of titles of programs and plays, of the artists who participated in them, of writers and the drafts they wrote, of actors and the programs in which they participated, and a general name index. The book also includes a facsimile of the manuscript Der Nayer Dybbuk [The New Dybbuk].
התאטרון של דז'יגאן ושומאכר, 1927-1980 = Stage as a temporary home : on Dzigan and Shumacher's theater, 1927-1980 /

Minguo shi qi wen xian zi liao hai wai shi yi you Beijing da xue, Beijing shi fan da xue, fu dan da xue, hua dong shi fan da xue, Nanjing da xue, Nanjing shi fan da xue, Wuhan da xue, Xiamen da xue he Zhejiang da xue deng gao xiao de tu shu guan zu cheng gao xiao tu shu guan li shi wen xian lian meng, xi tong sou ji he zheng li liao cun cang yu hai wai Minguo wen xian de shu mu xin xi, bing yu guo nei tu shu guan de Minguo wen xian cang shu jin xing shu ju bi jiao, xuan ze chu qi zhong wei jian yu guo nei tu shu guan shou cang de xue shu jia zhi jiao gao de wen xian zi liao, sou ji mu ben, xian liang ying yin fu zhi, bing hui ji er cheng. ben tao shu gong 270 ce, mu lu suo yin yi ce, gong shou lu hai wai Minguo wen xian zi liao 710 zhong.

民國時期文獻資料海外拾遺 /
《民國時期文獻資料海外拾遺》編輯組.

Reprint. 民國時期文獻資料海外拾遺由北京大學、北京師範大學、復旦大學、華東師範大學、南京大學、南京師範大學、武漢大學、廈門大學和浙江大學等高校的圖書館组成高校圖書館歷史文獻聯盟, 系統搜集和整理了存藏于海外民國文獻的書目信息, 並與國內圖書館的民國文獻藏書進行數據比較, 選擇出其中未見於國內圖書館收藏的學術價值較高的文獻資料, 搜集母本, 限量影印複製, 並匯輯而成. 本套書共270册, 目錄索引一冊, 共收錄海外民國文獻資料710種.

ha-teʼaṭron shel Dz'igan ṿe-Shumakher, 1927-1980 = Stage as a temporary home : on Dzigan and Shumacher's theater, 1927-1980 /
Hotsaʼat sefarim ʻa. sh. Y.L. Magnes, ha-Universiṭah ha-ʻIvrit,

The Stage as a Temporary Home takes us through the fascinating stages in the life and career of the duo Shimen Dzigan and Isroel Shumacher, over the course of half a century - from the beginning of their work at the Ararat avant-garde Yiddish theater in Łodz, Poland, and to their Warsaw theater, where they produced bold, groundbreaking political satire. The book further discusses their wanderings through the Soviet Union during the Second World War and their attempt to revive Jewish culture in Poland after the Holocaust, and finally describes their arrival in Israel, first as guest performers and later as permanent residents. Despite the restrictions on Yiddish actors in Israel, the duo insisted on performing in their own language and succeeded in translating the new Israeli reality into unique and timely satire. In the 1950s, they voiced a political and cultural critique of a kind that was not heard on any of the Hebrew stages. After they parted ways, and following the death of Shumacher in 1961, Dzigan continued to perform on his own and with other Israeli artists until his death in 1980. The book is based on rare recordings, transcriptions, programs, personal diaries, letters, photographs, oral testimonies, and critical articles, all of which come together to create the first critical portrait of this extraordinary duo. The book also examines their art, the connection between theater and politics, and the complex relationship between majority culture and minority language. The study includes several valuable indexes: of titles of programs and plays, of the artists who participated in them, of writers and the drafts they wrote, of actors and the programs in which they participated, and a general name index. The book also includes a facsimile of the manuscript Der Nayer Dybbuk [The New Dybbuk].
התאטרון של דז'יגאן ושומאכר, 1927-1980 = Stage as a temporary home : on Dzigan and Shumacher's theater, 1927-1980 /

Minguo shi qi wen xian zi liao hai wai shi yi you Beijing da xue, Beijing shi fan da xue, fu dan da xue, hua dong shi fan da xue, Nanjing da xue, Nanjing shi fan da xue, Wuhan da xue, Xiamen da xue he Zhejiang da xue deng gao xiao de tu shu guan zu cheng gao xiao tu shu guan li shi wen xian lian meng, xi tong sou ji he zheng li liao cun cang yu hai wai Minguo wen xian de shu mu xin xi, bing yu guo nei tu shu guan de Minguo wen xian cang shu jin xing shu ju bi jiao, xuan ze chu qi zhong wei jian yu guo nei tu shu guan shou cang de xue shu jia zhi jiao gao de wen xian zi liao, sou ji mu ben, xian liang ying yin fu zhi, bing hui ji er cheng. ben tao shu gong 270 ce, mu lu suo yin yi ce, gong shou lu hai wai Minguo wen xian zi liao 710 zhong.

民國時期文獻資料海外拾遺 /
《民國時期文獻資料海外拾遺》編輯組.

Reprint. 民國時期文獻資料海外拾遺由北京大學、北京師範大學、復旦大學、華東師範大學、南京大學、南京師範大學、武漢大學、廈門大學和浙江大學等高校的圖書館组成高校圖書館歷史文獻聯盟, 系統搜集和整理了存藏于海外民國文獻的書目信息, 並與國內圖書館的民國文獻藏書進行數據比較, 選擇出其中未見於國內圖書館收藏的學術價值較高的文獻資料, 搜集母本, 限量影印複製, 並匯輯而成. 本套書共270册, 目錄索引一冊, 共收錄海外民國文獻資料710種.

ha-teʼaṭron shel Dz'igan ṿe-Shumakher, 1927-1980 = Stage as a temporary home : on Dzigan and Shumacher's theater, 1927-1980 /
Hotsaʼat sefarim ʻa. sh. Y.L. Magnes, ha-Universiṭah ha-ʻIvrit,

The Stage as a Temporary Home takes us through the fascinating stages in the life and career of the duo Shimen Dzigan and Isroel Shumacher, over the course of half a century - from the beginning of their work at the Ararat avant-garde Yiddish theater in Łodz, Poland, and to their Warsaw theater, where they produced bold, groundbreaking political satire. The book further discusses their wanderings through the Soviet Union during the Second World War and their attempt to revive Jewish culture in Poland after the Holocaust, and finally describes their arrival in Israel, first as guest performers and later as permanent residents. Despite the restrictions on Yiddish actors in Israel, the duo insisted on performing in their own language and succeeded in translating the new Israeli reality into unique and timely satire. In the 1950s, they voiced a political and cultural critique of a kind that was not heard on any of the Hebrew stages. After they parted ways, and following the death of Shumacher in 1961, Dzigan continued to perform on his own and with other Israeli artists until his death in 1980. The book is based on rare recordings, transcriptions, programs, personal diaries, letters, photographs, oral testimonies, and critical articles, all of which come together to create the first critical portrait of this extraordinary duo. The book also examines their art, the connection between theater and politics, and the complex relationship between majority culture and minority language. The study includes several valuable indexes: of titles of programs and plays, of the artists who participated in them, of writers and the drafts they wrote, of actors and the programs in which they participated, and a general name index. The book also includes a facsimile of the manuscript Der Nayer Dybbuk [The New Dybbuk].
התאטרון של דז'יגאן ושומאכר, 1927-1980 = Stage as a temporary home : on Dzigan and Shumacher's theater, 1927-1980 /

Minguo shi qi wen xian zi liao hai wai shi yi /
"Minguo shi qi wen xian zi liao hai wai shi yi" bian ji zu.

Reprint. Minguo shi qi wen xian zi liao hai wai shi yi you Beijing da xue, Beijing shi fan da xue, fu dan da xue, hua dong shi fan da xue, Nanjing da xue, Nanjing shi fan da xue, Wuhan da xue, Xiamen da xue he Zhejiang da xue deng gao xiao de tu shu guan zu cheng gao xiao tu shu guan li shi wen xian lian meng, xi tong sou ji he zheng li liao cun cang yu hai wai Minguo wen xian de shu mu xin xi, bing yu guo nei tu shu guan de Minguo wen xian cang shu jin xing shu ju bi jiao, xuan ze chu qi zhong wei jian yu guo nei tu shu guan shou cang de xue shu jia zhi jiao gao de wen xian zi liao, sou ji mu ben, xian liang ying yin fu zhi, bing hui ji er cheng. ben tao shu gong 270 ce, mu lu suo yin yi ce, gong shou lu hai wai Minguo wen xian zi liao 710 zhong.

民國時期文獻資料海外拾遺 /
《民國時期文獻資料海外拾遺》編輯組.

Reprint. 民國時期文獻資料海外拾遺由北京大學、北京師範大學、復旦大學、華東師範大學、南京大學、南京師範大學、武漢大學、廈門大學和浙江大學等高校的圖書館组成高校圖書館歷史文獻聯盟, 系統搜集和整理了存藏于海外民國文獻的書目信息, 並與國內圖書館的民國文獻藏書進行數據比較, 選擇出其中未見於國內圖書館收藏的學術價值較高的文獻資料, 搜集母本, 限量影印複製, 並匯輯而成. 本套書共270册, 目錄索引一冊, 共收錄海外民國文獻資料710種.

ha-teʼaṭron shel Dz'igan ṿe-Shumakher, 1927-1980 = Stage as a temporary home : on Dzigan and Shumacher's theater, 1927-1980 /
Hotsaʼat sefarim ʻa. sh. Y.L. Magnes, ha-Universiṭah ha-ʻIvrit,

The Stage as a Temporary Home takes us through the fascinating stages in the life and career of the duo Shimen Dzigan and Isroel Shumacher, over the course of half a century - from the beginning of their work at the Ararat avant-garde Yiddish theater in Łodz, Poland, and to their Warsaw theater, where they produced bold, groundbreaking political satire. The book further discusses their wanderings through the Soviet Union during the Second World War and their attempt to revive Jewish culture in Poland after the Holocaust, and finally describes their arrival in Israel, first as guest performers and later as permanent residents. Despite the restrictions on Yiddish actors in Israel, the duo insisted on performing in their own language and succeeded in translating the new Israeli reality into unique and timely satire. In the 1950s, they voiced a political and cultural critique of a kind that was not heard on any of the Hebrew stages. After they parted ways, and following the death of Shumacher in 1961, Dzigan continued to perform on his own and with other Israeli artists until his death in 1980. The book is based on rare recordings, transcriptions, programs, personal diaries, letters, photographs, oral testimonies, and critical articles, all of which come together to create the first critical portrait of this extraordinary duo. The book also examines their art, the connection between theater and politics, and the complex relationship between majority culture and minority language. The study includes several valuable indexes: of titles of programs and plays, of the artists who participated in them, of writers and the drafts they wrote, of actors and the programs in which they participated, and a general name index. The book also includes a facsimile of the manuscript Der Nayer Dybbuk [The New Dybbuk].
התאטרון של דז'יגאן ושומאכר, 1927-1980 = Stage as a temporary home : on Dzigan and Shumacher's theater, 1927-1980 /

Minguo shi qi wen xian zi liao hai wai shi yi you Beijing da xue, Beijing shi fan da xue, fu dan da xue, hua dong shi fan da xue, Nanjing da xue, Nanjing shi fan da xue, Wuhan da xue, Xiamen da xue he Zhejiang da xue deng gao xiao de tu shu guan zu cheng gao xiao tu shu guan li shi wen xian lian meng, xi tong sou ji he zheng li liao cun cang yu hai wai Minguo wen xian de shu mu xin xi, bing yu guo nei tu shu guan de Minguo wen xian cang shu jin xing shu ju bi jiao, xuan ze chu qi zhong wei jian yu guo nei tu shu guan shou cang de xue shu jia zhi jiao gao de wen xian zi liao, sou ji mu ben, xian liang ying yin fu zhi, bing hui ji er cheng. ben tao shu gong 270 ce, mu lu suo yin yi ce, gong shou lu hai wai Minguo wen xian zi liao 710 zhong.

民國時期文獻資料海外拾遺 /
《民國時期文獻資料海外拾遺》編輯組.

Reprint. 民國時期文獻資料海外拾遺由北京大學、北京師範大學、復旦大學、華東師範大學、南京大學、南京師範大學、武漢大學、廈門大學和浙江大學等高校的圖書館组成高校圖書館歷史文獻聯盟, 系統搜集和整理了存藏于海外民國文獻的書目信息, 並與國內圖書館的民國文獻藏書進行數據比較, 選擇出其中未見於國內圖書館收藏的學術價值較高的文獻資料, 搜集母本, 限量影印複製, 並匯輯而成. 本套書共270册, 目錄索引一冊, 共收錄海外民國文獻資料710種.

ha-teʼaṭron shel Dz'igan ṿe-Shumakher, 1927-1980 = Stage as a temporary home : on Dzigan and Shumacher's theater, 1927-1980 /
Hotsaʼat sefarim ʻa. sh. Y.L. Magnes, ha-Universiṭah ha-ʻIvrit,

The Stage as a Temporary Home takes us through the fascinating stages in the life and career of the duo Shimen Dzigan and Isroel Shumacher, over the course of half a century - from the beginning of their work at the Ararat avant-garde Yiddish theater in Łodz, Poland, and to their Warsaw theater, where they produced bold, groundbreaking political satire. The book further discusses their wanderings through the Soviet Union during the Second World War and their attempt to revive Jewish culture in Poland after the Holocaust, and finally describes their arrival in Israel, first as guest performers and later as permanent residents. Despite the restrictions on Yiddish actors in Israel, the duo insisted on performing in their own language and succeeded in translating the new Israeli reality into unique and timely satire. In the 1950s, they voiced a political and cultural critique of a kind that was not heard on any of the Hebrew stages. After they parted ways, and following the death of Shumacher in 1961, Dzigan continued to perform on his own and with other Israeli artists until his death in 1980. The book is based on rare recordings, transcriptions, programs, personal diaries, letters, photographs, oral testimonies, and critical articles, all of which come together to create the first critical portrait of this extraordinary duo. The book also examines their art, the connection between theater and politics, and the complex relationship between majority culture and minority language. The study includes several valuable indexes: of titles of programs and plays, of the artists who participated in them, of writers and the drafts they wrote, of actors and the programs in which they participated, and a general name index. The book also includes a facsimile of the manuscript Der Nayer Dybbuk [The New Dybbuk].
התאטרון של דז'יגאן ושומאכר, 1927-1980 = Stage as a temporary home : on Dzigan and Shumacher's theater, 1927-1980 /

Minguo shi qi wen xian zi liao hai wai shi yi you Beijing da xue, Beijing shi fan da xue, fu dan da xue, hua dong shi fan da xue, Nanjing da xue, Nanjing shi fan da xue, Wuhan da xue, Xiamen da xue he Zhejiang da xue deng gao xiao de tu shu guan zu cheng gao xiao tu shu guan li shi wen xian lian meng, xi tong sou ji he zheng li liao cun cang yu hai wai Minguo wen xian de shu mu xin xi, bing yu guo nei tu shu guan de Minguo wen xian cang shu jin xing shu ju bi jiao, xuan ze chu qi zhong wei jian yu guo nei tu shu guan shou cang de xue shu jia zhi jiao gao de wen xian zi liao, sou ji mu ben, xian liang ying yin fu zhi, bing hui ji er cheng. ben tao shu gong 270 ce, mu lu suo yin yi ce, gong shou lu hai wai Minguo wen xian zi liao 710 zhong.

民國時期文獻資料海外拾遺 /
《民國時期文獻資料海外拾遺》編輯組.

Reprint. 民國時期文獻資料海外拾遺由北京大學、北京師範大學、復旦大學、華東師範大學、南京大學、南京師範大學、武漢大學、廈門大學和浙江大學等高校的圖書館组成高校圖書館歷史文獻聯盟, 系統搜集和整理了存藏于海外民國文獻的書目信息, 並與國內圖書館的民國文獻藏書進行數據比較, 選擇出其中未見於國內圖書館收藏的學術價值較高的文獻資料, 搜集母本, 限量影印複製, 並匯輯而成. 本套書共270册, 目錄索引一冊, 共收錄海外民國文獻資料710種.

ha-teʼaṭron shel Dz'igan ṿe-Shumakher, 1927-1980 = Stage as a temporary home : on Dzigan and Shumacher's theater, 1927-1980 /
Hotsaʼat sefarim ʻa. sh. Y.L. Magnes, ha-Universiṭah ha-ʻIvrit,

The Stage as a Temporary Home takes us through the fascinating stages in the life and career of the duo Shimen Dzigan and Isroel Shumacher, over the course of half a century - from the beginning of their work at the Ararat avant-garde Yiddish theater in Łodz, Poland, and to their Warsaw theater, where they produced bold, groundbreaking political satire. The book further discusses their wanderings through the Soviet Union during the Second World War and their attempt to revive Jewish culture in Poland after the Holocaust, and finally describes their arrival in Israel, first as guest performers and later as permanent residents. Despite the restrictions on Yiddish actors in Israel, the duo insisted on performing in their own language and succeeded in translating the new Israeli reality into unique and timely satire. In the 1950s, they voiced a political and cultural critique of a kind that was not heard on any of the Hebrew stages. After they parted ways, and following the death of Shumacher in 1961, Dzigan continued to perform on his own and with other Israeli artists until his death in 1980. The book is based on rare recordings, transcriptions, programs, personal diaries, letters, photographs, oral testimonies, and critical articles, all of which come together to create the first critical portrait of this extraordinary duo. The book also examines their art, the connection between theater and politics, and the complex relationship between majority culture and minority language. The study includes several valuable indexes: of titles of programs and plays, of the artists who participated in them, of writers and the drafts they wrote, of actors and the programs in which they participated, and a general name index. The book also includes a facsimile of the manuscript Der Nayer Dybbuk [The New Dybbuk].
